results.title: ACMI Presentations
results.brief_description:
John Smithies, CEO of ACMI delivered a series of presentations relating to the opening of ACMI at Federation Square. This is a collection these presentations and materials including:

  1. Power point presentation on 5th September 2002
  2. Original files and movies for power point presentation
  3. ACMI cinepac used at Naming ceremony for Alfred Deakin Building

results.title: Achimota
results.creator_credit: John Page and British Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Shows the introduction of higher education to West Africa, Nigeria and the Gold Coast in the early part of the 20th century with the establishment of Achimota College, Gold Cast. Emphasises the need for preserving valuable elements of the African culture. Conversely however, ends up reinforcing the dominance of the western way of life over Africans under colonial rule. Commentary by Dr Julian Huxley.

results.title: Achievement in Hong Kong
results.brief_description: The life of the Chinese population of Hong Kong and the emergency housing scheme. The history of the colony; the Chinese tradition; the disastrous fire of Christmas 1953 and the subsequent establishment of the Government Resettlement Department. Progress on the rehousing scheme, building large concrete blocks of emergency dwellings, to be converted into permanent flats as conditions improve. Cinematographer: Julius Evans

results.title: Accountancy today!
results.brief_description: A career film. An Accountant needs an inquiring mind and the ability to communicate effectively; he must collect and record facts, analyse them, prepare reports, discuss financial implications, control their results. After a three year full-time course of study at a university or technical college, he can gain employment in a secure, well-paid position which may lead to promotion to top executive positions in commerce, industry, government departments or private practice.

results.title: Auxiliary views: single auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a brief review of the principles of orthographic projection and goes on to show that the three views obtained by projection on the three principal planes do not represent the true shape of some surfaces of an object that has one or more slanting faces. This condition is shown to require projection of the slanting surface on a plane which is parallel to it and not one of the principal planes. Thus auxiliary projection is explained and defined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America

results.title: Selection of dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”

Introduces the principles which govern the choice of dimensions. These principles are shown to be based on two factors: (1) the functional characteristics of the object, which includes consideration of the accuracy demanded and the relation of the portion to other elements of the unit or machine; and (2) the manufacturing methods used in making the object.

results.title: Sections and conventions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”

Explains why sectioning in engineering drawing is often necessary, and describes the various types of sectional views and the special language used.
